RitualDruid2.synopsis: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.

RitualDruid3.synopsis: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Inwe is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Inwe is ashamed at her involvement.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Inwe is still a bit shaken - she knows the threat is over, but she's still jumping at shadows.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool.

RitualDruid4.synopsis: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Elwyn is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Elwyn is conflicted - she knows why the ritual had to be stopped, but she's scared that they've been left defenceless.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Elwyn is calm but exhausted, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.The player always encounters Elwyn around a sacred druid pool.

AD_RitualDruid1.synopsis: This AD plays after the druid's ritual has been stopped. In this AD, Aelar is dazed from days of chanting.

RitualDruid5.synopsis: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Tahani is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Tahani is furious that players stopped the ritual - even though Kagha had ulterior motives, Tahani still believes her path was best and that players had no right to intervene.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Tahani isn't convinced the threat is really over. She thinks her fellow druids will lead them down the same path again, taking pity on people that will only bring trouble to their door.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool. She's more or less the xenophobic conservative of the chanting druids.

AD_RitualDruid3.synopsis: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Inwe was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Inwe is feeling sorry for herself. She's overcome with shame for being a part of a shadow druid plot.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Inwe isn't quite convinced the danger is over. She's jumping at shadows, imagining danger where there's presumably none.

AD_RitualDruid2.synopsis: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.

AD_BirdSender.synopsis: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |

AD_RitualDruid5.synopsis: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Tahani was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In both states, Tahani is bitter, muttering her xenophobic ideas to herself. She thinks the tieflings (and the player) are the cause of all their troubles and that they should've been thrown out a long time ago.

AD_Ritual.synopsis: Five druids participate in a ritual around a sacred pool. The chant will summon a coccoon of thorns that will encircle their entire grove. Lines play sequentially, each druid saying one line, then the next, etc.They're chanting at a normal to low volume. They're attempting to suss power out from the earth itself, but they're not forcing it out. There should be a loose rhythm to it (think Arwen from LoTR when she summons the river horses), but it shouldn't come across like a drum circle.

AD_SearchingBird.synopsis: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |

RitualDruid1.synopsis: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.

PAD_RecognizeRite.synopsis: The voicebark is triggered after talking to one of the druids performing the ritual. It's always a DRUID in the party that react first. This VB won't fire after talking to Kagha and getting all the details about the ritual

BirdSender.synopsis: This dialogue can take place in two different states. In the first, Apakusis is short and defensive. The grove's ranking leader, Kagha, has gathered support to close off the grove to outsiders with an intense ritual. She doesn't trust Kagha, and quietly despairs to see her grove turn to such measures.In the second state, the ritual has been stopped. She's shocked at the revelation that Kagha had been involved with Shadow Druids, and is having trouble accepting it.The player finds this druid speaking to a bird in the druid grove.

AD_RitualDruid4.synopsis: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Elwyn was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Elwyn is preoccupied with the goblins - she's afraid that without the protection the ritual would have provided, they don't have a chance against them.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Elwyn is calm, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.

RitualDruid2_0.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_0.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
RitualDruid2_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

RitualDruid2_1.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_1.text: It'll take time to mend our grove. Thanks to you, we have it.
RitualDruid2_1.context: NodeContext: Speaking of the emotional scars and rifts that their infighting has created in the grove.

RitualDruid2_2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2_2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2_5.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_5.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2_5.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid2_3.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_3.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
RitualDruid2_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

RitualDruid2_4.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

RitualDruid2_7.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_7.text: Kagha fooled us. We're lucky you were here.

RitualDruid2_9.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_9.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid2_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

RitualDruid2_10.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_10.text: Kagha lied to us. She betrayed us.
RitualDruid2_10.context: NodeContext: Angry - he feels personally betrayed by Kagha for siding with the evil shadow druids.

RitualDruid2_8.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_8.text: She was a blight on the grove. You were right to put her down.
RitualDruid2_8.context: NodeContext: Angry, but coolly. He feels personally betrayed by Kagha for siding with the evil shadow druids.

RitualDruid2_6.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_6.context: InternalNodeContext: DEN_ShadowDruid_Event_SaghaTurnedGoodNodeContext: Angry, but coolly. He feels personally betrayed by Kagha for siding with the evil shadow druids.

RitualDruid2_11.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_11.text: Complexum tuum, ab terra ortum, ad nos defer.
RitualDruid2_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, ahb TEH-rah ohr-TOOM, ahd nohs dee-FEHR.

RitualDruid2_12.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

RitualDruid3_0.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_0.text: I'm seeing goblins in every shadow.
RitualDruid3_0.context: NodeContext: The goblin threat is dealt with, but she's still afraid and paranoid.

RitualDruid3_1.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

RitualDruid3_2.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

RitualDruid3_4.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_4.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
RitualDruid3_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

RitualDruid3_5.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_5.text: Complexum tuum, ab terra ortum, ad nos defer.
RitualDruid3_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, ahb TEH-rah ohr-TOOM, ahd nohs dee-FEHR.

RitualDruid3_7.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_7.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
RitualDruid3_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

RitualDruid3_8.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_8.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid3_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

RitualDruid3_9.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_9.text: To think we almost finished the ritual...
RitualDruid3_9.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3_3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_3.text: I felt honoured when I was chosen to participate. Now I feel guilty I didn't object.
RitualDruid3_3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3_10.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_10.text: We thought we were doing the right thing.
RitualDruid3_10.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3_11.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_11.text: I know you stopped the goblins, but I can't stop looking over my shoulder.
RitualDruid3_11.context: NodeContext: The goblin threat is dealt with, but she's still afraid.

RitualDruid3_6.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_6.text: Makes it hard to sleep at night.
RitualDruid3_6.context: NodeContext: The goblin threat is dealt with, but she's still afraid and paranoid.

RitualDruid4_1.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

RitualDruid4_2.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_2.text: Do you hear them? The birds. They're beautiful.
RitualDruid4_2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's exhausted emotionally, but feels calm for the first time in a long time.

RitualDruid4_11.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_11.text: I've thought of nothing but goblins and tieflings for so long, I stopped listening.
RitualDruid4_11.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's referring to her anxiety preventing her from listening to the birds in the grove.

RitualDruid4_3.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_3.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid4_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

RitualDruid4_4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_4.text: I know you had to stop her, but Kagha was just trying to protect us.
RitualDruid4_4.context: NodeContext: Sagha turned to 'evil' means to protect the grove. Elwyn doesn't approve of her methods, but she would have welcomed the safety.

RitualDruid4_0.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_0.text: What are we doing to do now? She's gone. Master Halsin's missing. We're exposed.
RitualDruid4_0.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over.

RitualDruid4_7.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_7.text: She went too far, but at least she had a plan.
RitualDruid4_7.context: InternalNodeContext: DEN_ShadowDruid_Event_SaghaTurnedGoodNodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's speaking of Kagha, who turned to 'evil' means to protect the grove.

RitualDruid4_5.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_5.text: The grove feels safe again. We have you to thank for that.
RitualDruid4_5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's exhausted emotionally, but feels calm for the first time in a long time.

RitualDruid4_6.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_6.text: Complexum tuum, ab terra ortum, ad nos defer.
RitualDruid4_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, ahb TEH-rah ohr-TOOM, ahd nohs dee-FEHR.

RitualDruid4_8.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_8.text: You get to move on. We're stuck here, defenceless.
RitualDruid4_8.context: NodeContext: She's conflicted - she knows the player was right to stop the ritual, but she's irritated that they got in the way nonetheless.

RitualDruid4_9.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_9.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
RitualDruid4_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

RitualDruid4_10.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

RitualDruid4_12.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_12.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
RitualDruid4_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

AD_RitualDruid1_0.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1_0.text: Complexum tuum... it's still in my head.
AD_RitualDruid1_0.context: NodeContext: Prnounced: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, He's got a chant stuck in his head.

AD_RitualDruid1_2.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1_2.text: Maybe if I just close my eyes...

RitualDruid5_1.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid5_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

RitualDruid5_2.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

RitualDruid5_3.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_3.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
RitualDruid5_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

RitualDruid5_5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_5.text: You think you saved us? You just prolonged the inevitable.
RitualDruid5_5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5_4.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_4.text: Sooner or later, other outsiders will bring trouble to the grove.
RitualDruid5_4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5_7.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_7.text: I've got nothing to say to you, outsider.
RitualDruid5_7.context: NodeContext: Dismissive/angry. Defiant. The ritual that would have sealed off the grove has been stopped, but she doens't think it should have been.

RitualDruid5_8.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_8.text: Kagha was right. We must put ourselves first.
RitualDruid5_8.context: NodeContext: Defiant. The ritual that would have sealed off the grove has been stopped, but she doens't think it should have been.

RitualDruid5_0.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_0.text: She's dead because of your meddling.
RitualDruid5_0.context: NodeContext: She's pissed at the player for killing Kagha, even though she sided with evil shadow druids.

RitualDruid5_6.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_6.text: You had no right to intervene. You're not one of us.
RitualDruid5_6.context: InternalNodeContext: DEN_ShadowDruid_Event_SaghaTurnedGoodNodeContext: She's pissed at the player. Defiant. The ritual that would have sealed off the grove has been stopped, but she doens't think it should have been.

RitualDruid5_9.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_9.text: Complexum tuum, ab terra ortum, ad nos defer.
RitualDruid5_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, ahb TEH-rah ohr-TOOM, ahd nohs dee-FEHR.

RitualDruid5_10.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

RitualDruid5_11.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_11.text: This will happen again. We won't have you to rescue us when it does.
RitualDruid5_11.context: NodeContext: She's bitter. 'Rescue' is said almost sarcastically. The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5_12.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_12.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
RitualDruid5_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

AD_RitualDruid3_0.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_0.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid3_1.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_1.text: The grove doesn't feel the same.
AD_RitualDruid3_1.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid3_2.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Inwe is being hard on herself for falling for Kagha's ploy to turn their grove to the evil shadow druids.

AD_RitualDruid3_3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_3.text: I can't believe I fell for her lies.
AD_RitualDruid3_3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Inwe is being hard on herself for falling for Kagha's ploy to turn their grove to the evil shadow druids.

AD_RitualDruid3_4.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid3_5.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_5.text: We have to make this right.
AD_RitualDruid3_5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Inwe is being hard on herself for falling for Kagha's ploy to turn their grove to the evil shadow druids.

AD_RitualDruid3_6.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_6.text: It wasn't just Kagha. We're all at fault.
AD_RitualDruid3_6.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Inwe is being hard on herself for falling for Kagha's ploy to turn their grove to the evil shadow druids.

AD_RitualDruid3_7.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3_7.text: I have to pull it together.
AD_RitualDruid3_7.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid2_0.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_0.text: How could we be so blind?
AD_RitualDruid2_0.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

AD_RitualDruid2_1.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_1.text: So much anger... we have to let it go.
AD_RitualDruid2_1.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat has passed. Karrik has calmed - he is feeling introspective.

AD_RitualDruid2_2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_2.text: Kagha - even her name tastes sour.
AD_RitualDruid2_2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

AD_RitualDruid2_3.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_3.text: We'll be stronger for all of this.
AD_RitualDruid2_3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat has passed. Karrik has calmed - he is feeling introspective.

AD_RitualDruid2_4.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_4.text: I won't forgive her. I can't.
AD_RitualDruid2_4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

AD_RitualDruid2_5.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_5.text: Shadow Druids! What was she thinking?
AD_RitualDruid2_5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha - she was siding with evil shadow druids.

AD_RitualDruid2_6.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_6.text: Trust in the Treefather. He'll bring us balance.
AD_RitualDruid2_6.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat has passed. Karrik has calmed - he is feeling introspective.

AD_RitualDruid2_7.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2_7.text: We lost our way. Never again.
AD_RitualDruid2_7.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat has passed. Karrik has calmed - he is feeling introspective.

AD_BirdSender_1.speaker: Apikusis
AD_BirdSender_1.text: Bring us news, my friend. Bring us hope.

AD_BirdSender_2.speaker: Apikusis
AD_BirdSender_2.text: Please return, Master. Before it's too late.

AD_RitualDruid5_0.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_0.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

AD_RitualDruid5_1.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_1.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

AD_RitualDruid5_2.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_2.text: We should be looking out for ourselves.
AD_RitualDruid5_2.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would seal off the grove has stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Tahani is angry - she believes players overstepped by stopping the ritual. Her anger is simmering, though - she's trying to keep her cool.

AD_RitualDruid5_3.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_3.text: Damn outsiders, sticking their noses into our affairs.
AD_RitualDruid5_3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would seal off the grove has stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Tahani is angry - she believes players overstepped by stopping the ritual. Her anger is simmering, though - she's trying to keep her cool.

AD_RitualDruid5_4.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_4.text: Why should we sacrifice ourselves for strangers?
AD_RitualDruid5_4.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would seal off the grove has stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Tahani is angry - she believes players overstepped by stopping the ritual. Her anger is simmering, though - she's trying to keep her cool.

AD_RitualDruid5_5.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_5.text: How many will die the next time we throw open our doors?
AD_RitualDruid5_5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

AD_RitualDruid5_6.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_6.text: Those tieflings brought nothing but trouble.
AD_RitualDruid5_6.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

AD_RitualDruid5_7.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5_7.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would seal off the grove has stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Tahani is angry - she believes players overstepped by stopping the ritual. Her anger is simmering, though - she's trying to keep her cool.

AD_Ritual_0.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual_0.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

AD_Ritual_1.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual_1.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
AD_Ritual_1.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

AD_Ritual_2.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual_2.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

AD_Ritual_3.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual_3.text: Complexum tuum, ab terra ortum, ad nos defer.
AD_Ritual_3.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, ahb TEH-rah ohr-TOOM, ahd nohs dee-FEHR.

AD_Ritual_4.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual_4.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
AD_Ritual_4.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

AD_Ritual_5.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual_5.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
AD_Ritual_5.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

AD_SearchingBird_1.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird_1.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird_3.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird_3.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird_2.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid1_0.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

RitualDruid1_1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1_1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1_5.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_5.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

RitualDruid1_2.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_2.text: Complexum tuum, ab terra ortum, ad nos defer.
RitualDruid1_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, ahb TEH-rah ohr-TOOM, ahd nohs dee-FEHR.

RitualDruid1_3.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_3.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
RitualDruid1_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

RitualDruid1_4.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_4.text: You look as tired as I feel.

RitualDruid1_6.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_6.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
RitualDruid1_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

RitualDruid1_7.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_7.text: Things are starting to calm down, thanks to you. We can finally get some rest.
RitualDruid1_7.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, but at peace. The goblin threat has been dealt with.

RitualDruid1_8.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_8.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid1_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

RitualDruid1_9.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_9.text: How long have you been there? Blessed Silvanus, I need to lie down.
RitualDruid1_9.context: NodeContext: Dazed - he's a bit out of it.

RitualDruid1_10.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

PAD_RecognizeRite_0.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite_0.text: That ritual. A common growth spell, but... altered, somehow.

PAD_RecognizeRite_2.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite_2.text: But nothing to worry about... right?

PAD_RecognizeRite_1.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite_1.text: That ritual. A common growth spell, but... altered, somehow.

PAD_RecognizeRite_3.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite_3.text: That ritual - it's no garden-variety growth spell.

BirdSender_8.speaker: Player
BirdSender_8.text: What were you saying to that bird?

BirdSender_80.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_80.text: The bird knows. She needs to know. You do not.

BirdSender_60.speaker: Player
BirdSender_60.text: I'm not with these other tieflings - I'm a druid. You can speak freely.

BirdSender_52.speaker: Player
BirdSender_52.text: Come now - surely a fellow druid is entitled to know.

BirdSender_35.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_35.text: I- forgive me. My love for my brethren is strong, but 'trust'? It is delicate.

BirdSender_61.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_61.text: More follow Kagha every day. They are afraid and she offers a simple solution - eject the refugees and we will be safe.

BirdSender_31.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_31.text: Perhaps not. But that does not make it right.

BirdSender_54.speaker: Player
BirdSender_54.text: Sounds like she has to be stopped. How would we do that?

BirdSender_6.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_6.text: A druid and an outsider? We can do nothing without turning the others against us.

BirdSender_93.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_93.text: Only Master Halsin can stop this. I pray my bird returns with news of him.

BirdSender_22.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_22.text: If not, I fear for my people.

BirdSender_67.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_67.text: He left with the adventurers. They went treasure hunting in an old temple near here.

BirdSender_46.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_46.text: Master Halsin did not chase treasure. I do not know what he was chasing. But he never returned.

BirdSender_85.speaker: Player
BirdSender_85.text: Are there any healers in this place?

BirdSender_71.speaker: Player
BirdSender_71.text: Shouldn't the ritual protect the grove? You're not helping the others prepare it.

BirdSender_1.speaker: Player
BirdSender_1.text: I hear a ritual can protect the grove. Are you helping prepare it?

BirdSender_45.speaker: Player
BirdSender_45.text: You still haven't told me what you were doing with that bird.

BirdSender_14.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_14.text: It searches for news of Master Halsin. Only he can set this right.

BirdSender_83.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_83.text: If he is gone - well, pray that he is not.

BirdSender_41.speaker: Player
BirdSender_41.text: I'm not with the other tieflings, if that's what worries you.

BirdSender_55.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_55.text: I- forgive me. I don't fear your blood, tiefling. I fear my brethren.

BirdSender_27.speaker: Player
BirdSender_27.text: Hmm... Suspicious. Do the other druids know? Because I could tell them.

BirdSender_56.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_56.text: We may talk, but - I do not trust my brethren.

BirdSender_86.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_86.text: Before you do that, see how our First Druid treats outsiders. Then decide if you would put your faith in her.

BirdSender_42.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_42.text: I'll tell you, but please don't do that again.

BirdSender_70.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_70.text: Your brutish demands have no place here.

BirdSender_16.speaker: Player
BirdSender_16.text: I helped defend this grove - I'm not your enemy.

BirdSender_64.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_64.text: I - forgive me. It is not you I fear, it is my brethren.

BirdSender_25.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_25.text: Not all enemies are outside our walls.

BirdSender_91.speaker: Player
BirdSender_91.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

BirdSender_28.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_28.text: Find Nettie in her room. Through the carved door, deeper in the grove.

BirdSender_4.speaker: Player
BirdSender_4.text: It doesn't look like you're helping with the ritual.

BirdSender_79.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_79.text: The ritual is Kagha's decision. But she is not our leader.

BirdSender_40.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_40.text: Master Halsin welcomed the refugees in. I wait for him to resolve this.

BirdSender_90.speaker: Player
BirdSender_90.text: Is that why you were talking with that bird?

BirdSender_29.speaker: Player
BirdSender_29.text: Halsin won't be resolving anything if he's dead.

BirdSender_72.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_72.text: Pray he is not. For the refugees' sake.

BirdSender_2.speaker: Player
BirdSender_2.text: Are you helping to prepare for the ritual?

BirdSender_3.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_3.text: But if Master Halsin does not return, Kagha will give the order. And my voice will not matter.

BirdSender_69.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_69.text: I knew Kagha was desperate, but I never imagined she'd get Cloakwood involved.
BirdSender_69.context: NodeContext: She distrusted Kagha, but didn't think that she'd gone so far as to turn 'evil'

BirdSender_74.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_74.text: And it cost her her life. What a waste.
BirdSender_74.context: NodeContext: Players killed Kagha for her actions (or she turned good, but died in the combat)

BirdSender_78.speaker: Player
BirdSender_78.text: A waste? Don't you think she deserved it?

BirdSender_9.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_9.text: I could have forgiven her scheming. But the child...
BirdSender_9.context: NodeContext: Kagha either threatened to kill a child - or successffully did so.

BirdSender_92.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_92.context: NodeContext: She's glad that Kagha is dead - she killed a child.

BirdSender_63.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_63.text: She meant to kill that poor girl. There's no coming back from that.
BirdSender_63.context: NodeContext: She's still not sure if that meant Kagha should have died, but she's not torn up over it.

BirdSender_82.speaker: Player
BirdSender_82.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

BirdSender_58.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_58.text: You pulled her from the brink. She owes you her life.
BirdSender_58.context: NodeContext: Players convinced Kagha to abandon the shadow druids.

BirdSender_33.speaker: Player
BirdSender_33.text: You've known her longer - has she really changed?

BirdSender_94.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_94.text: By all appearances, yes - when I look at her, I see the Kagha I once knew.

BirdSender_7.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_7.text: But it could be another lie. I pray it isn't.

BirdSender_43.speaker: Player
BirdSender_43.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

BirdSender_81.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_81.text: Shadow Druids... I still can't believe it.

BirdSender_21.speaker: Player
BirdSender_21.text: I'm looking for a healer - help me narrow the search?

AD_RitualDruid4_0.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_0.text: The grove isn't safe. Not anymore.
AD_RitualDruid4_0.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

AD_RitualDruid4_1.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_1.text: We don't stand a chance against an army of goblins.
AD_RitualDruid4_1.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

AD_RitualDruid4_2.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_2.text: We'll fight, but we can't win.
AD_RitualDruid4_2.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

AD_RitualDruid4_3.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_3.text: Feels like I've been holding my breath for a tenday.
AD_RitualDruid4_3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat against the grove eliminated. Elwyn has finally relaxed, exhausted but grateful that the danger has passed.

AD_RitualDruid4_4.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_4.text: We need a plan. We need a leader.
AD_RitualDruid4_4.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

AD_RitualDruid4_5.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_5.text: No more goblins. No more fighting. Just... peace.
AD_RitualDruid4_5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat against the grove eliminated. Elwyn has finally relaxed, exhausted but grateful that the danger has passed.

AD_RitualDruid4_6.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_6.text: I'd forgotten how beautiful our grove is.
AD_RitualDruid4_6.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat against the grove eliminated. Elwyn has finally relaxed, exhausted but grateful that the danger has passed.

AD_RitualDruid4_7.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4_7.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat against the grove eliminated. Elwyn has finally relaxed, exhausted but grateful that the danger has passed.
